coreConcepts.definition: A cryptographic container that gives every piece of data its own unique identity, ownership verification, and access controls. Implemented as a Secret (smart contract) with Notes (append-only feed). Not for cryptocurrency -- for proving origin and ownership of any data.

A unique blockchain address (0x...) that establishes a verifiable cryptographic foundation for individuals, businesses, or objects. Unlike identity systems, Digital Names focus on ownership and origin rather than identity.
The systematic creation of authenticated data objects with built-in provenance, ownership verification, and immutable origin tracking. Transforms electrons into knowledge into wealth.
WHO created it + WHO owns it. The two verifiable attributes that transform raw data into Knowledge and Knowledge into Wealth.
The core Rootz primitive. A blockchain smart contract that holds encrypted data with granular access controls. Everything in Rootz is built on Secrets.
An append-only log of entries attached to a Secret. The mechanism for accumulating data over time within a Data Wallet -- like a journal or feed.
An on-chain smart contract that represents a Digital Name. Manages authorized signers, key rotation, and authorization relationships.
The first entry in a Data Wallet, recording WHO created the data, WHAT was created, WHEN (blockchain timestamp), and WHERE (device/domain). Immutable proof of origin.
The Rootz blockchain infrastructure layer (from Greek episteme, meaning knowledge). Manages Secrets, Notes, and Identity Contracts on Polygon.

The foundational Rootz philosophy that every digital object -- social media posts, IoT devices, documents, business data -- should have its own cryptographic wallet with proof of origin and ownership.
The dual-layer documentation architecture from Veritize. Plain English is the human-readable Markdown layer. Plain AI is the machine-ingestible JSON/Schema layer. Every document has both.
